body: so i've been to the waterpark a while ago and checking all the slides which will i go first. i chose their signature slide which is called "the twin cobra" and i decided to try it because of its extreme loops that make some people dizzy. so i try it and what happened is i really didn't expect it to happen to me. when i splashed already in the water, i can't move my legs and i was just swinging my arms that it feels like i'm in a deep water. i didn't realized i was unconscious. it's a good thing the lifeguard pulled me and i suddenly rose up and just walk out from the ladder and i was coughing because there's still water inside me. i'm still lucky that i was still able to get up and not ending up remaining unconscious.

title: sharing something that scares me out

replies.body:
Something like this happened to me when I rose my first roller coaster.

Badically I didn't know what I was getting myself into. I was in line for Apollos Chariot at Bucsh gardens. I got on the ride, and we were going up. I sudden got this weird feeling as I looked down (bad idea). As we were going down, my insides were all trying to come up. The only that held them down was all the air coming into me, which I almost passed out because of. The whole time after that, I was crying, except nothing came out because of all the air. When I got off, I was in so much shock that my whole body was shaking. I litterally was about to faint. I didn't ride another single ride the rest of the 7 hours we were there (this was a school trip).

And from that day on, I have sworn never to ride Apollos Chariot again.
replies.body_tagged:
